page.title: 14The Courtauld Factory
page.content: {Bocking}was larger and more important than{Braintree}in the medieval woollen industry. Following the decline of wool, silk weaving was introduced. For 160 years the textile factory, started by{Samuel Courtauld, provided employment for many people from{Bocking}and the surrounding area. The invention of artificial fibres led to expansion to international size and the giant organisation closed the Bocking site in 1981. Most of the derelict buildings, dating from around 1920, have been{vandalised}and are at present, an eyesore. Some of the smaller buildings are being used by small industrial concerns (page 15). The building, fronting Bovingdon Road, is to be converted into flats. The largest building is to be pulled down and 118 houses and 113 flats built in its place.
